chunks.text: So, hello everyone, I again welcome you to the course on fuzzy logic inference and machine

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: So, I have already covered the introduction to fuzzy logic, but again I will brief you

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: or I can say, I can again recap you what we have learnt in the first lecture.

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: So, basically what is fuzzy logic, it is a basically a mathematical approach which is

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: used to handle the uncertainty and imprecision, it means when we are not able to decide between

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: two values, we will go to the fuzzy logic, so why we need fuzzy logic, because traditional

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: logic only deals with two values, either it is absolutely true or either it is absolutely

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: false means, in between 0 and 1, we have to choose, okay but in real situation, it is

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: not like that, we cannot only choose in between black and white, we are sometimes often we

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: have to go for the grey areas, that's why we have to, that's why we will need, we are

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: going for to apply the fuzzy logic in that type of cases, where we are not able to take

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: the decision in between the 0 and 1 and in between the black and white, okay.

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: So, this is the basic idea in which fuzzy logic allows actually us for degrees of the

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: truth means, in the fuzzy logic, we can decide whether the situation is 30% correct, 70%

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: correct, 50% correct, 100% correct, so that type of decision allows us the fuzzy logic,

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: so instead of only choosing the true or false, we can take that decision on the basis of

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: the degrees of the truth, how much our content is truth with the help of that we can take

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: the decision.

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: Now, with the help of example, I again explain you like in temperature description, if we

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: are using classical logic, then we have only two option, either it is hot or it is not

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: hot, in between these two we have to choose, but in the case of fuzzy logic, we can explore

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: more options like if it is slightly hot means, it is its degree is degree of truth is 0.4,

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: okay, now if it is moderately hot, then its degree of truth is 0.7, if it is very hot,

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: then its degree of truth is 0.9, so with the help of fuzzy logic, we are able to classify

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: to explore more options, okay.

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: So, basically this is the diagram which I have, this is the diagram of that example,

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: which I have explained in the previous slide, like if it is hot water, then in the case

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: of Boolean logic, we have only two option, either yes, it is hot water or no, no, it

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: is not hot water, okay, but in the case of fuzzy logic, we have more options like it

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: is very much hot, we can categorize its degree of truth is 0.9 means, it is close to the

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: desired output, okay, now in the case, in the second case, we have little, it means

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: 50% chance, then very less, it means its degree of truth is 0.1, okay, so basically this figure

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: shows that the fuzzy logics are, fuzzy logics help us to explore more options, when we are

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: not able to decide in between 0 and 1, we can explore more option with the help of the

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: fuzzy logic, okay.

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: So, now, first we will understand what is the architecture of the fuzzy system, how

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: many components are there, how fuzzy logic is working, how they are able to take the

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: decision in between more than two values, okay, so fuzzy logic basically, it consists

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: of four main parts, first one is the fuzzification module, then second one is the rule base,

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: then the third one is base interference engine, then fourth one is defuzzification module,

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: so one by one we can explore all these components, what these components are doing in the fuzzy

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: logic systems.

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: So, basically this is the process of fuzzy logic system, first what we will do, we will

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: apply our crisp input, we will apply our input to the fuzzification module, so what will

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: they do, it will converge the crisp input to the fuzzy input, okay, it will take the

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: base input or crisp input which we are having, might be that input is from some sensors or

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: basically whatever type of data we have, we can input to the fuzzy logic system, then

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: the first block, fuzzyification module, what they will do, it will convert our data to

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: the fuzzy sets, fuzzy inputs, okay, then second one is rule base, what they will do, in this

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: rule base we have decided some rules, we have implemented some rules, what we have to do

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: with this, with input data, what operation we have to perform, so in this rule base we

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: have fetch some rules, second interference engine it will operate, it will take the fuzzy

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: input and then rules and it will apply and then it will that on the basis of that rules

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: and as input it will convert to the fuzzy output.

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: Then fourth one is defuzzification module, again what they will do, it is the basically

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: inverse of the fuzzification module, it takes the fuzzy output and convert it into the crisp

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: output which the peoples are able to understand what the output is, okay, so this is the fuzzy

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: modification module, so basically it is a module or component for transforming the system

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: inputs means, it basically converts the crisp number into fuzzy steps, okay, with the help

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: of that fuzzification module we can convert our crisp input to the fuzzy input, okay.

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: Now, the crisp number, what are crisp number, crisp number are those inputs or data which

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: are measured by our sensors and then fuzzification pass them into the control system for the

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: further processing, basically it takes the data and convert it into the fuzzy steps or

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: the fuzzy data we can say.

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: Now, what are the key elements of the fuzzification module, first one is the input variable which

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: we are applying that is that can be anything like it can be a real world measurement for

chunks.text: example, it may be a temperature data, it may be a speed, it may be pressure, it can

chunks.title: Lecture 2

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: categorizing our input into multiple, multiple number like low, medium, high, if it is a

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: Boolean logic or crisp input then we are only able to categorize in between two, either

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: low or high but in the case of fuzzy input we can categorize our data into three type,

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: whether it is low, it is medium, it is high, so that is the basically what the advantage

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: of fuzzy set is that.

chunks.title: Lecture 2

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: method basically this uses the fuzzy set for both the input and output means in input also

chunks.title: Lecture 2

chunks.title: Lecture 2

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: to find the output but in the case of Mamdani we are using what the fuzzy set also for the

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: input and also for the output in the both the cases we are using the same fuzzy sets

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: but in the case of Sugino we are using the mathematical function.

chunks.title: Lecture 2

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: takes the fuzzy set input generated by the interference engine means basically it takes

chunks.title: Lecture 2

chunks.title: Lecture 2

chunks.title: Lecture 2
chunks.text: that output we can use in our real world application okay that's that defuzzification

chunks.text: can do like if we can take the real life example of that automatic washing machine so like

text: So, hello everyone, I again welcome you to the course on fuzzy logic inference and machine learning techniques, I am your instructor for this course. So, this is our lecture 2, now in previous lecture we have seen the basics of fuzzy logic and why we need fuzzy logic, we have seen in our previous lecture. Now, in this lecture we will start with our syllabus of the unit 1. So, our first unit is basically based on the basics of the fuzzy logic, so this is the course for that. Now, I have cover, I have basically categorized this unit into 5 parts, first one is, first we will read, first we will learn about the introduction to fuzzy logic and its importance, then we will see the difference between the classical set and the fuzzy set, then we will see fuzzy membership function and their different types, then we will see the operation on fuzzy steps by applying the union, intersection and complement different types of operation, how we will implement on the fuzzy sets, we will see in that and then at the end we will see the concept of fuzzification and defuzzification with the help of some examples. So, I have already covered the introduction to fuzzy logic, but again I will brief you or I can say, I can again recap you what we have learnt in the first lecture. So, basically what is fuzzy logic, it is a basically a mathematical approach which is used to handle the uncertainty and imprecision, it means when we are not able to decide between two values, we will go to the fuzzy logic, so why we need fuzzy logic, because traditional logic only deals with two values, either it is absolutely true or either it is absolutely false means, in between 0 and 1, we have to choose, okay but in real situation, it is not like that, we cannot only choose in between black and white, we are sometimes often we have to go for the grey areas, that's why we have to, that's why we will need, we are going for to apply the fuzzy logic in that type of cases, where we are not able to take the decision in between the 0 and 1 and in between the black and white, okay. So, this is the basic idea in which fuzzy logic allows actually us for degrees of the truth means, in the fuzzy logic, we can decide whether the situation is 30% correct, 70% correct, 50% correct, 100% correct, so that type of decision allows us the fuzzy logic, so instead of only choosing the true or false, we can take that decision on the basis of the degrees of the truth, how much our content is truth with the help of that we can take the decision. Now, with the help of example, I again explain you like in temperature description, if we are using classical logic, then we have only two option, either it is hot or it is not hot, in between these two we have to choose, but in the case of fuzzy logic, we can explore more options like if it is slightly hot means, it is its degree is degree of truth is 0.4, okay, now if it is moderately hot, then its degree of truth is 0.7, if it is very hot, then its degree of truth is 0.9, so with the help of fuzzy logic, we are able to classify to explore more options, okay. So, basically this is the diagram which I have, this is the diagram of that example, which I have explained in the previous slide, like if it is hot water, then in the case of Boolean logic, we have only two option, either yes, it is hot water or no, no, it is not hot water, okay, but in the case of fuzzy logic, we have more options like it is very much hot, we can categorize its degree of truth is 0.9 means, it is close to the desired output, okay, now in the case, in the second case, we have little, it means 50% chance, then very less, it means its degree of truth is 0.1, okay, so basically this figure shows that the fuzzy logics are, fuzzy logics help us to explore more options, when we are not able to decide in between 0 and 1, we can explore more option with the help of the fuzzy logic, okay. So, now, first we will understand what is the architecture of the fuzzy system, how many components are there, how fuzzy logic is working, how they are able to take the decision in between more than two values, okay, so fuzzy logic basically, it consists of four main parts, first one is the fuzzification module, then second one is the rule base, then the third one is base interference engine, then fourth one is defuzzification module, so one by one we can explore all these components, what these components are doing in the fuzzy logic systems. So, basically this is the process of fuzzy logic system, first what we will do, we will apply our crisp input, we will apply our input to the fuzzification module, so what will they do, it will converge the crisp input to the fuzzy input, okay, it will take the base input or crisp input which we are having, might be that input is from some sensors or basically whatever type of data we have, we can input to the fuzzy logic system, then the first block, fuzzyification module, what they will do, it will convert our data to the fuzzy sets, fuzzy inputs, okay, then second one is rule base, what they will do, in this rule base we have decided some rules, we have implemented some rules, what we have to do with this, with input data, what operation we have to perform, so in this rule base we have fetch some rules, second interference engine it will operate, it will take the fuzzy input and then rules and it will apply and then it will that on the basis of that rules and as input it will convert to the fuzzy output. Then fourth one is defuzzification module, again what they will do, it is the basically inverse of the fuzzification module, it takes the fuzzy output and convert it into the crisp output which the peoples are able to understand what the output is, okay, so this is the fuzzy modification module, so basically it is a module or component for transforming the system inputs means, it basically converts the crisp number into fuzzy steps, okay, with the help of that fuzzification module we can convert our crisp input to the fuzzy input, okay. Now, the crisp number, what are crisp number, crisp number are those inputs or data which are measured by our sensors and then fuzzification pass them into the control system for the further processing, basically it takes the data and convert it into the fuzzy steps or the fuzzy data we can say. Now, what are the key elements of the fuzzification module, first one is the input variable which we are applying that is that can be anything like it can be a real world measurement for example, it may be a temperature data, it may be a speed, it may be pressure, it can be anything. Second one is the membership function, we have to define the degree of belongingness to the fuzzy set, we will see in detail what is the membership function means. And third one is the fuzzy set, basically it categorize, it the category how we are categorizing our input into multiple, multiple number like low, medium, high, if it is a Boolean logic or crisp input then we are only able to categorize in between two, either low or high but in the case of fuzzy input we can categorize our data into three type, whether it is low, it is medium, it is high, so that is the basically what the advantage of fuzzy set is that. Now, second is knowledge based or either rule based, so rule based is basically a component which is we are using for storing the set of rules, in the in that rule based we have we have implemented, we have designed some rules, what type of rules, if then type of rules. So, in the if then conditions which are given by the experts or which are desired by a system we are using for controlling the decision making system, we are in this we want what type of decision we want, we can take with the help of or we can categorize with the help of the rule based system, in this we will design the rules and then we will apply that rules to the input. Then the third, now again what is the basic component of that knowledge based, so first one is fuzzy rule based which is a set of if then rules, we are that govern the system behavior that decide the system behavior, then the database which are which like what we are storing in the membership function and what the other parameters are there like if temperature in this like if we have taken, if we I will write a example for that how so that you can understand better what is the rule based. So, basically like we have we have executed some rule in that or we have write some rule in the in that rule based, what is that if temperature is high, then fan speed should be fast, we have decided that would. If the temperature is high, then fan speed, then our fan speed should be fast, if temperature is low, then our fan speed should be slow. So, this type of rules we design in that rule based. now what is the third main component is its interference engine, now what is the interference engine, so basically it is a component in fuzzy logic system because all the information is processed in the all the information that we have inputted is processed in that inference engine in which it allows the user to find the matching degree between the current fuzzy input and their rules, it match what is the current input and it match that input with the rules okay. So now after the matching degree this system determine which rule is to be added on that system which rule should be added according to the given input field when all the rules are fired then they are combined there then they are combined for developing the control action on the basis of that okay. Now this component is also responsible for applying fuzzy logic rule to the fuzzified input and generating the fuzzy output means with the help of that fuzzification component we get the fuzzy input because that component has converted the crisp input in the fuzzy input and then that input we have applied to the inference engine and the second input for the inference engine is the if rule base, rule base which we have designed then they apply that rules to the input and then generate output on the basis of that rules okay. So basically we have two types of inference method in that first one is the Mamdani interference method basically this uses the fuzzy set for both the input and output means in input also we are using fuzzy set and the output we are also using the fuzzy set but in the case of Sugino interference method we are using a mathematical function for output to simplify the computation or means in Sugino interference method we are using the mathematical equation to find the output but in the case of Mamdani we are using what the fuzzy set also for the input and also for the output in the both the cases we are using the same fuzzy sets but in the case of Sugino we are using the mathematical function. Now the last step is the fuzzification module, defuzzification module sorry so defuzzification is a module or a component of the fuzzy logic system which takes the fuzzy system which takes the fuzzy set input generated by the interference engine means basically it takes the output from the interference engine and then transform that into a crisp value. So basically what they will do it convert the in simplification we can say it convert the fuzzy output into a crisp value that can be used in our real world application so that that output we can use in our real world application okay that's that defuzzification can do like if we can take the real life example of that automatic washing machine so like we have categorized our input into two parts first one is the dirt level second is wash time like if the dirt is very low in the cloth then the wash time of washing machine should be of 20 minutes like if the dirt is medium in nature then our wash time should be of 40 minutes if the dirt is very high means if our cloth is of very high dirt then the wash time of washing machine should be 60 minutes okay. Now what the process was fuzzification do? Fuzzification do the convert dirt level to the fuzzy values so if we are applying the input in the form of dirt level so that fuzzification converts that dirt level to the fuzzy values. Now what the knowledge base we have now then we have to prepare some rules like which we have shown in the previous slides like if the dirt level is 10 percent then the washing machine should be run of the time 20 minutes if the dirt level is 50 percent then the washing machine time should be running time should be of 40 minutes that rule we have decided and that that rules we have to write in the knowledge base then what interference engine will do it determine the wash time on the basis of that input the dirt level and then on the basis of that rules they give the they determine the basically the wash time and then the wash time output they will give to the defuzzification component what it will do it will convert the fuzzy output to the exact minutes means how much how minute how many minutes that washing machine have to be run okay.
